item.description:
@rjop455 wrote:

,a computer can’t be completely random no matter what. But if you add a human element then you can :). So like how long a human holds down a key then randomize it. Because a human is completely random :).

Great script by the way.

item.title: Random Generator
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

I dunno if this is usefull to anyone. Some noob on rs said it was impossible for a computer to generate random numbers.

It got me wondering how it was actually done so somehow i ended up making this. LOL still dont know how random numbers are generated. So if someone could tell me… Thanks

[scar]program RandomNumberGenerator;
var
randomomg, i, ii : integer;
writetest : string;

procedure writeln1;
begin
writeln(writetest);
writeln(‘Random number between 0-10 = ‘+inttostr(randomomg)+’ (’+(writetest)+’)’);
writeln(’ ');
end;

begin
repeat
cleardebug;
randomomg:= random(11);
if randomomg>5 then writetest:=‘Above 5’ else writetest:=‘Below 6’;
writeln1;
i:= i + 1;
//wait(40)
ii:= ii + randomomg;
until(i = 100)
writeln('Value of 100 random Nmbers = '+floattostr(ii));
writeln(‘Average = ‘+Floattostr((ii/(100))));
writeln(’’);
end.[/scar]

Read full topic
